chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: This section provides general information about Platypus Platform.

section.title: About Platypus Platform
section.para: The Platypus Platform is a software platform designed for rapid building of complex applications for enterprise-level information systems in JavaScript.

The main goal of the platform is to accelerate development process, providing maximum possible automation of routine operations. To perform common tasks, ready-to-go and proven solutions are provided. The platform hides technical aspects of the implementation from a developer and enables to concentrate on application business domain.
The Platypus Platform uses two application programming languages:

listitem.para: JavaScript (compatible with the ECMA-262-3 standard) is used to write program logic;
SQL is used to access data.

section.para: Application creation and editing, deployment, debugging and maintenance are performed using the Platypus Application Designer based on the NetBeans. However, individual files, for example, JavaScript modules, can be edited in any text editor.
The Platypus Application Designer includes following development tools:

listitem.para: Application database structure visual editor;
SQL queries visual editor;
JavaScript code editor;
User interface forms visual editor.

section.para: The platform also offers a set of features, making development process extremely productive:

listitem.para: JavaScript modules automatic dependencies resolving, manual resolving is also avaliable.
SQL quries with named parameters and SQL clauses re-use.
Data model and automatic O/RM (Object-Relation Mapping) for JavaScript.
Desktop cross-platform as well as HTML5 web-browser user interface presentation sharing the same code and the GUI layout.

The GUI widgets which directly interact with the data model, allowing implementation of a CRUD (Create-Read-Update-Delete) user interface with visual configuration and without or just a little coding.
Built-in security support, including users authentication and authorization, constraints of access to application resources.
Application database schema structure and initial applicaton data migrations tools.

section.title: Application architecture
section.para: Platypus applications have a tree structure which contains directories and files. Some files or file groups have a special meaning to the platform and called application elements. That is the building bricks for an application.
The types of application elements in Platypus Platform are:

listitem.para: Module—a structural unit of the JavaScript software code, and its data model.
Form—a module with a user interface layout.
Report—a module with a template of the generated office document.
Query — a database query in SQL language.
Database diagram—a visual representation of the database structure.

note.para: During the development process, the application tree is stored on the disk in the project's src subfolder, but for production operation the application, including its resources can be deployed directly in the database MTD_ENTITIES table.

section.para: In general, the platform works on three-tier archeticture including presentation, logic and database tiers. The presentation and the logic tier can be combined in some configurations.

In case no-server configuration the presentation tier and logic tier operate at Java SE desktop client, and in case server configuration the presentation tier operates in the client, either at Java SE desktop client or HTML5 browser and the logic tier runs on application server.
The figure below shows a simplified diagram of components interaction and data flow.
JavaScript code and the data model compatible user interface widgets can use the data model to read and write database data.

Data flow components can operate on a client as well as on a server. In case of no-server configuration the data flow components work on the client. In case of configuration with an application server, data flow components work on the client as well as on the server, particularly on different computers, while providing a transparent data exchange.

The unique feature of the platform is its Object/Relational Mapping (O/RM) implementation. In runtime its generates JavaScript objects datasets matching the database relations. To enable this process it uses schema information from the database and the SQL query texts.

The usage of data model simplifies many data processing operations, since it provides automatic synchronization of entities data, automatic saving of modified data, simplified support of transactions, centralized management of resources, etc.
The application development workflow usually consists of the following steps:

listitem.para: Determination of the database structure for the application specific knowledge domain.
Implementation of this structure in the form of relational entities in the database using the Database structure diagrams visual editor.

Writing the data sampling queries and its parameters; if required, implementation of queries for updating and adding data in SQL language (data inserting/updating in most cases can be completed automatically by the data model).
Implementation of the application logic as JavaScript modules,
for each module:
determination module's of the data model using visual tool;
writing JavaScript code, for example to implement the business-logic.
Implementation of the application user interface as forms using visual tool,
for each form:
determination of the form's data model;
creation of the form layout using the visual editor;
writing JavaScript code responsible for the user interface.
Implementation of reports using the reports tool,
for each report:
determination of the report's data model;
creation of the report template using the visual editor;
writing JavaScript code if some non-standard report generation processing required.
